title: Effective Communication Planning
description: Master Push, Pull, and Interactive communication methods to deliver the right information to the right stakeholders.
objectives: Select Push, Pull, or Interactive methods based on stakeholder needs
Distinguish formal vs informal communication and when each applies
Apply communication channels formula to understand complexity
Choose communication technology for distributed teams

screens.headline: 47 Stakeholders. 1,081 Channels. One Question: How Do You Communicate Without Drowning Everyone in Noise?

dialogue.text: Just CC everyone on everything. That's transparency, right?

screens.learningHook: Wrong method = information overload or missed critical updates. Match communication method to stakeholder needs—not your convenience.

screens.title: Communication Method Matching
screens.instructions: For each stakeholder group, select the appropriate method and approach.

scenarios.title: Investors & Board (9 people)
description: High power, time-constrained (CEOs of other companies)
Ava: 'I get 300+ emails a day. Don't add to the noise.'
Need: Financial status, risks, major decisions

questions.question: What communication METHOD is most appropriate?

options.text: HYBRID: Monthly PUSH summary + PULL dashboard
CC all on every project email
Post to intranet, let them check when interested

feedback.correct: Perfect! Hybrid respects their time. Monthly PUSH ensures they see key info. PULL dashboard for those wanting details.
feedback.incorrect: Time-constrained executives need monthly digests (PUSH) with optional dashboard (PULL) for deeper dives.

scenarios.title: Location Managers (5 people across 3 time zones)
description: Distributed: NYC, Miami, Chicago, Denver, Seattle
Maya: 'I can't wait for weekly email—I need answers NOW.'
Need: Real-time Q&A, share lessons, escalate blockers

questions.question: What communication METHOD is most appropriate?

options.text: HYBRID: Weekly video (rotating time) + Slack channel
Daily 9am PT video call (all must attend)
Weekly video (rotating time) + Slack for real-time

feedback.correct: Excellent! Weekly rotating call accommodates time zones. Slack provides the 'NOW' support Maya needs.
feedback.incorrect: Distributed teams need async primary (Slack) + sync scheduled (weekly rotating to accommodate zones).

scenarios.title: Compliance & Legal (3 people)
description: Jordan: 'Don't email me 50 documents upfront. I need a library I can search.'
Need: On-demand access to permits, contracts, regulations
Constraint: Not all relevant at once, needs searchable repository

questions.question: What communication METHOD is most appropriate?

options.text: PUSH: Email all documents at project start
HYBRID: PULL repository + PUSH alerts for critical changes
SharePoint (searchable, organized) + email alerts for regulatory changes

feedback.correct: Perfect! PULL (searchable repository) for reference. PUSH (alerts) for critical regulatory changes.
feedback.incorrect: Jordan needs searchable reference (PULL) plus alerts for time-critical regulatory changes (PUSH).

scenarios.title: Kitchen Staff (30+ people across 5 locations)
description: Frontline workers, can't attend live meetings during service
Need: Recipes, safety protocols, equipment manuals on-demand
Sam: 'We're paying overtime because staff call HQ to find manuals.'
Constraint: Working during service, mixed tech literacy

questions.question: What communication METHOD is most appropriate?

options.text: HYBRID: PULL knowledge base + PUSH SMS for safety alerts
Mobile knowledge base (searchable) + SMS for critical safety

feedback.correct: Perfect! Mobile knowledge base for self-service (reduces HQ calls by 60%). SMS for critical safety reaches everyone immediately.
feedback.incorrect: Kitchen staff need searchable, mobile access (PULL) plus SMS for urgent safety (PUSH). They can't attend live sessions.

methods.name: PUSH
methods.useWhen: Time-sensitive, many recipients, no response needed

methods.name: PULL
methods.useWhen: Reference material, different people need different parts

methods.name: INTERACTIVE
methods.useWhen: Complex topics, immediate feedback, relationship building

content.insight: Most PMs default to PUSH (email). Match method to stakeholder needs, not your convenience.

blocks.title: Decision Tree: Choosing the Right Method

content.insight: When in doubt, use HYBRID: PUSH summary + PULL details.

content.guidance: Start informal (coaching), escalate to formal if issue persists.

content.implication: 47 stakeholders = 1,081 channels. Can't manage all—use targeted methods.

content.bestPractice: Async primary + sync scheduled at rotating times

correct.text: This is exactly what I need. One-page summary monthly, dashboard for details. No noise, just signal.

incorrect.text: I set up a filter to auto-archive your project emails after Day 3. You're generating noise, not insight.

correct.text: Weekly call keeps us aligned, Slack gives me real-time help when stuck. This hybrid works perfectly.
SharePoint saves me hours. I search when I need it, and your alerts ensure I don't miss regulatory changes.
Overtime for 'calling HQ to find manuals' dropped 60%. SMS alert during equipment recall potentially prevented a fire.

screens.title: Critical Safety Alert
screens.context: FDA issued URGENT RECALL of refrigeration units in 3 locations. Staff are mid-dinner service.

scenario.title: Equipment Recall During Service
details: Fire risk if units not unplugged immediately
18 affected staff across Chicago, Denver, Miami

questions.question: Which communication method ensures ALL affected staff receive and ACT within 30 minutes?

options.text: SMS to all 18 staff + follow-up calls to managers

feedback.correct: Perfect! SMS (PUSH) reaches everyone instantly on phones. Follow-up calls (INTERACTIVE) confirm action. Life-safety = fastest channel + confirmation.
feedback.incorrect: Life-safety requires fastest channel (SMS reaches phones immediately during service) plus confirmation (calls to managers). Email and intranet are too slow.

screens.title: Communication Planning Mastery
screens.summary: Match communication methods to stakeholder needs—not your convenience. Push for broadcast, Pull for reference, Interactive for dialogue.
takeaways: HYBRID: Combine methods (PUSH summary + PULL details)
Channels formula: n(n-1)/2 explains why 'CC all' fails
Distributed teams: Async primary + sync at rotating times

characterClosing.text: I thought 'CC everyone' was transparency. You showed me it's noise. Investors need digests, managers need dialogue, staff need self-service. Right method for right stakeholder.
